title: Requires certain trucks, tractors and tractor-trailer or semitrailer combinations to be equipped with convex mirrors
summary: Requires trucks, tractors and tractor-trailer or semitrailer combinations to be equipped with convex mirrors when registered in or regularly making deliveries in a city with a population of one million or more.

BILL NUMBER:S2207

TITLE OF BILL:

An act
to amend the vehicle and traffic law
and the insurance law, in relation to convex mirrors

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:

Adds a new subdivision 10-e to section 375 of the vehicle and traffic
law, to require every truck, tractor, and tractor-trailer or
semitrailer registered in New York with a gross weight of 26,000
pounds or more to be equipped with a convex mirror on the front of
such vehicle or combination of vehicles. The new requirement is only
applicable in New York City.
The measure also provides for the use of alternate technologies, and
the elimination of some streets or vehicles from the requirement
where there is no improvement in visibility or safety.
Finally, the bill allows for an insurance deduction for the use of the
mirrors.

JUSTIFICATION:

The use of cross-over mirrors is one important means of trying to
prevent traffic fatalities and injuries. The mirrors have a small
cost, which is largely ameliorated because they are a legitimate
business expense, and will result in a better insurance rating.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:

2004: S.6489 - Senate Transportation
2005: S.2210 - 3rd reading
2006: S.2210 - Transportation
2007: S.6297 - Rules
2008: S.6297 - Transportation
2010: S.2198 - Transportation

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:

None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:

180 days after it shall have become a law and requires DMV to post
regulations prior to that date.
